p: C. longa rhizome essential oil has also exhibited strong antioxidant potential when combined with other essential oils—for instance, Z. officinale. In this case, the combination of both showed higher DPPH radical scavenging activity (IC 50 3.75 µL/mL vs. 4.28 and 7.19 µL/mL), as well as stronger β-carotene–linoleic acid bleaching (65.24% vs. 59.88 and 55.82%) than C. longa and Z. officinale oils alone, respectively [ 235]. This last test has been commonly used to compare the lipid peroxidation inhibitory activity of either individual compounds or mixtures, despite possible scattered results due to different factors like the chemical composition and extracting solvent [ 264].
